author: Russell Florence Jr.
title: Zoot returns with ‘Goblins’
text:
Zoot Theatre Company, Dayton’s stunningly imaginative and whimsical puppet/mask troupe, returns Saturday, Oct. 10 with a special Halloween-themed original work entitled “Goblins” at Yellow Cab Tavern.
Adapted and staged by Zoot co-founder Aaron Vega from Scottish author/poet/minister George MacDonald’s 1872 book “The Princess and the Goblin,” “Goblins” tells the story of Irene, an isolated princess, and her friend Curdie, a miner’s son, coping with mischievous creatures that live in a mountain. MacDonald, a mentor of Lewis Carroll, influenced a host of authors including C.S. Lewis, G.K. Chesterton, Mark Twain, and J.R.R. Tolkien.
Continue reading on MyDaytonDailyNews.com. »
